result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth R Nelson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth R Nelson was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit DNA sample.

AMENDED 11/2/15: Loss of all good time due to jail violations.
COUNTS 2&3 DISMISSED.

Defendant Kenneth R Nelson in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count  one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statement by ADA Long and Atty. Sarbacker. Court imposed 60 days jail starting Oct. 28, 2015 at 7 p.m.  Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08. $518 costs Submit DNA sample. No jail credit. Cts. 2&3 dismissed.
